name: Copaiva
Relationship: Antidote: BELL.; MERC.Compare: SANTALUM - (aching in kidneys); CANNAB.; CANTH.; BAROSMA; CUBEB; APIS; VESPA; ERIG.; SENECIO; SEPIA.

Head: Excessive sensitiveness; pain in occiput
Dull, frontal headache, passes to occiput and back again, with throbbing, worse right side and motion
Scalp sensitive
Sensitive to sharp sounds
Respiratory: Cough, with profuse, gray, purulent expectoration
Tickling in larynx, trachea, and bronchi
Bronchial catarrh, with profuse greenish, offensive discharge
Stomach: Gastric troubles during menstruation or following urticaria
Gas and intestinal flatulence, urging to stool and difficult passage with pain
Burning pressure; painful micturition by drops
Retention, with pain in bladder, anus, and rectum
Greenish; turbid color; peculiar pungent odor
Nose: Rawness and soreness of nostrils with stopped-up feeling; dryness of posterior nares
Profuse, thick, fetid discharge from nasal passages, running down throat at night
BURNING AND DRYNESS, crusts on turbinated bones
Marked catarrhal condition in upper respiratory tract
Female: Itching of vulva and anus, with bloody purulent discharge
Profuse, strong-smelling menstrual discharge, with pains radiating to hip bones, with nausea
Skin: Circumscribed, lenticular patches, with itching; mottled appearance
Rectum: Stools covered with mucous, with colic and chilliness
Burning and itching of anus, caused by piles

details: Acts powerfully on mucous membranes, especially that of the urinary tract, the respiratory organs, and the skin, here producing a well-marked nettle-rash. Colds and catarrhs.
